title: Curly casual sans "What's My Line?"
content:
I'm sure it's hand-drawn, but it seems like I've seen a similar font. It looks like something that would come out of House Industries, but the closest I could find was [Countryhouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&subpage=lettersetter&id=188), which didn't quite fit.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WML1%5B1%5D_5459.jpg)
author: pdxuser

comments.content:
Looks like an old Photolettering face. The "What's My Line" show came out in the 1950s. I don't know the age of this pioece though. Where is Bennet Surf and Dorothy Killgallon when you need them?!

ChrisL

This looks like that freebee face bundled with something that early teen girls used to overuse!

ChrisL

The above is from the syndicated 70s version, but the lettering is pretty close to the original:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/line%5B1%5D_6531.jpg)

Though they used other fonts, too:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_42452507_line_203%5B1%5D_4307.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/hardingbbcwml%5B1%5D_3902.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/whatsmyline%5B1%5D_4580.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440im_/http:/typophile.com/files/05adco_5505.large1%5B1%5D.jpg)

(More or less) similar:

[Fantini](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/fantini/)  
 [Pink Mouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/pink-mouse/)  
 [Curlz](http://web.archive.org/web/20141107170440/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/curlz-mt/familytree.html)

Didn’t find anything at House, Fontdiner or Fontbros.

Although Curls is the one I was trying to remember, I think Jan has it as good as you can with either Fantini or Pink Mouse. I'd pick whichever one waqs produced first.

ChrisL
